ResourceHeader.ResourceName: Meteorological Operational A (MetOp A) Space Environment Monitor 2 (SEM-2) Processed, Uncorrectecd Data at 2 s Resolution
ResourceHeader.Description: The MetOp-A SEM data consists of location information, magnetic field estimates, energy fluxes, and total energies from the Medium Energy Proton/Electron Detector (MEPED) and the Total Energy Detector (TED).
ResourceHeader.Acknowledgement: European Space Agency; EUMETSAT (European Organisation for the Exploitation of Meteorological Satellites)

InformationURL.Name: European Organisation for the Exploitation of Meteorological Satellites SEM page
InformationURL.Description: Information about the Space Environment Monitor-2 (SEM-2) experiment on the MetOp-A mission.

InformationURL.Name: European Space Agency SEM information.
InformationURL.Description: Information about the Space Environment Monitor-2 (SEM-2) experiment on the MetOp-A mission.

AccessURL.Name: Direct access to the NOAA MetOp SEM data
AccessURL.Description: Direct link to theNOAA MetOp SEM processed full resolution netcdf data. The data are sorted by year and spacecraft. The data files are daily files.

AccessInformation.Acknowledgement: NOAA; EUMETSAT (European Organisation for the Exploitation of Meteorological Satellites)

TimeSpan.Note: Time format in data files is year month day hour minute seconds.

Parameter.Name: Universal Time
Parameter.Description: Universal time.

Structure.Description: Universal Time expressed milliseconds since 1970, year, day of year, and milliseconds of day.

Parameter.Name: Satellite identification number
Parameter.Description: 2 digit number identifying the satellite the data is from.

Parameter.Name: Satellite Hemisphere Location
Parameter.Description: Satellite direction 0-North/1-South.

Parameter.Name: Altitude of the Spacecraft
Parameter.Description: Altitude of the satellite.

Parameter.Name: Geographic Latitude of sub-satellite point.
Parameter.Description: Geographic Latitude Position of sub-satellite point in degrees.

Parameter.Name: Geographic Longitude of sub-satellite point.
Parameter.Description: Geographic Longitude Position of sub-satellite point in degrees.
